title: The Heck is up with the Circlejerk?
body: What even is this?  Almost every other post I see is whining for Ekko to be majorly nerfed, and when playing as him or playing against him I haven't really noticed a need for that.  Sure, if he gets fed he's annoying, but no more so than other champions if they get fed.  His ult has a high AP scaling, yes, but it puts him in a very vulnerable posistion.  He telegraphs a lot (dont follow an Ekko when you have low health, just like a Singed), especially with his W.  If your team gets caught in that W they kind of deserve to die with how long the delay is on the stun.  Everyone just loves to QQ when they get beat by a champion whose mechanics they feel like they shouldn't have to learn and still be able to crush.  "OOOO I'm low, how about I stand in that mirage that Ekko guy is leaving behind?" *R* "OP NERF PLS NO WAY I COULD HAVE AVOIDED THAT."

Personally, I love Ekko because he requires a lot of planning and skill to play. You have to think; where are my enemies going to move? Are they going to chase me? Do I have the damage to backtrack with my ult and still get out alive? He does massive damage, yes. That's something people are always going to complain about with any burst-type mage assassin. LeBlanc is a prime example; she does ridiculous amounts of damage without her ult, and being able to double up on that can one-shot any squishy. The thing about burst mages like Ekko is that they tend to take a bit more planning and skill than other champions, and because they take more skill, it's much, much more rewarding when you do the right thing and do it well.

While he will have a huge nerf coming because of the people who whine and complain because they went 0/15 against a champion that actually takes skill, I think Ekko is fine how he is. Wanna know what kills Ekko? CC. I was just playing Hexa earlier, and in a 48 minute match, and I died I think 17 times (I had more kills, however), because they could land their CC before I had a chance to R, E, or flash. The moment they locked me down, whoever was around converged and killed. Ranged champions with CC, like Cait or KogMaw are a problem. Slow him down and keep him from getting close, and there's nothing to worry about.  If he can't touch you, he can't kill you. A huge portion of his damage comes from his E and his passive; both basic attacks. He has to hit you to do the damage, you know? While his dash is just that, a dash, it can only take him so far.

But to round this off without furthering a huge wall of text, I think if you do well as a champion like Ekko, you deserve it. It's not easy. It requires far more thought than your average champion. Not to say that it doesn't take a certain degree of skill to play other champions, but just that there's a huge learning curve for Ekko, and that he's by far one of the more difficult champions to play well, right up there with Azir (having to control multiple soldiers at once and pay attention to where they are, you are, and your enemies are) and... uh, Urgot. Because he's just a mess to play.

Just because it's a common occurrence doesn't make it any less ridiculous.  And I honestly don't believe the Ekko hate is justified for reasons I've outlined elsewhere in this thread.

"If you're low, don't chase him". No. If you don't have 3k health and over 100 MR while he has no void staff, don't chase him.

His kit is so damn easy to combo without even using his W. If you have to chase Ekko at all, your carries have to make sure there's at least two or three beef cakes between themself and Ekko because if he tosses his Q behind him while you guys are chasing him,  he can then press R, get a second proc of his passive, have done 1.5x his AP and huge bases, then AA with a Lichbane, which would've also proc'd his passive, doing 2.7x his AP. Even without a Lichbane, he can do 2.2x his AP without even landing the 2nd part of his Q. If just the first .2x AP ratio part of it hits to slow the carry and his ghost is within about a 500ish radius, he'll pretty much go Annie on some one's ass and do her entire combo and all he has to do is land the first part of the Q on anyone who's chasing him. Any carry that even gets tapped by the first bit is dead. Instantly. 

When we compare this combo to LEBLANC'S own combo... Well.. I'll start with Ekko's numbers with just this tiny combo that only utilizes one and a half abilities and a single AA.

Q's first damage. 160+.2x AP. We'll say he has 500 AP. That's 260 base. Then there's his R which does 500+1.3x AP, which is 1150 base. His Passive then gives him 15+(12xLevel) plus .7x AP, which at level 18 to make it easy is 231+350, 581. Add it all together, that's 1991. That's with 500 AP at level 18, which is a decent amount. Not too many items in. 

Now, let's look at LB. Q does 310 plus .8x AP in total, which is 710 damage. R is 600 plus 1.2x AP, which is 1200, then her W which is 245 plus .6x AP, totaling 545. That combo would do 2455. 

She does 500 damage, but has to use 3 abilities and has to be within the range. Ekko on the other hand is a little scarier where he does. It's a bit scary.

Now, I know most of you prolly are thinking 'LB does 500 more, that's a lot!', well... You can always E before pressing R on Ekko to help add in that as well, which does 170 base plus .2x AP, so an extra 270. 

This champion is meant to be an in and out champion who zones his enemies, which is true because of how ungodly quickly he can destroy a carry. His ghost and his W pretty much describe pure death and are one of the scariest things in the world, but his kit is a little overloaded. Unlike LB, he has sustained damage on his W to execute. It does do 5% base with about 2%ish per 100 AP of Missing Health on anyone who's got 30% or less health. His kit is overtuned, it really is. It needs some nerfs, but not as extreme as some are saying. Like his W could lose a little bit of the ratio and be closer to 1.5% per 100 AP instead and a 1.2x or 1.1x ratio on his ulti, which could be compensated for slightly by making his Q do .3 on the first hit and .5 on the second rather than .2 and then .6 respectively.
Welcome to Gameplay & Balance.

Because every single time a new champion comes out, people will either have a bad experience against them and whine that they're OP, or have a bad experience _as_ them and whine that they're UP. The main difference is usually how much damage they do; Bard's in a good spot, but his damage is incredibly low, especially with his ult eating up his power budget. He also has a super-high skill cap, which in most people's minds renders him useless. By contrast, Ekko has an actual damage output (he's an assassin, what do you expect?), and while he does take a lot of skill to play well, people who can pick him up quickly will inevitably make him slaughter people while everyone figures out how to counter him.

Honestly, a lot of the time these complaints stem from the fact that people need time to adjust to the new thing. Azir was considered really weak on release. A couple comprehensive bugfixes and a learning curve later, and they had to nerf his range just to bring him in line. In the long run, it's very possible that Ekko will need some number adjustments, but at this point he's only been out for two days. It's a little too early to say for sure how badly he needs those nerfs.

Kits should be designed with counterplays in mind, and by that I mean pre-defined weakness, and not just relying solely on the enemy players' mechanical faults, that's capitalising, not counterplaying.

Kits that lack actual counterplay is just trouble in the long run, doesn't matter what's the champ's current position.
